meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel shame or embarrassment.
meanings.sent1: Her mistake outshamed her in front of the whole class.
meanings.sent2: His rude behavior outshamed everyone else at the party.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter managed to outshame himself by spilling drinks on the guests.
meanings.sent4: The bright spotlight seemed to outshame the dim candlelight in the room.
meanings.sent5: The embarrassing video will surely outshame any previous blunders.

meanings.definition: To surpass in causing shame or embarrassment.
meanings.sent1: The elaborate prank managed to outshame all previous attempts.
meanings.sent2: Her extravagant outfit outshamed all the other guests at the event.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy tried to outshame the cat by knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The grand fireworks display seemed to outshame the simple sparklers.
meanings.sent5: The impressive speech will surely outshame any other presentations.
